basic.description: A lecture-seminar-laboratory course dealing with occupational biomechanics, work physiology, anthropometry, and skill acquisition as related to workplace environments.  Other physical factors of ergonomics to be studied will be:  posture at work stations, spinal and upper limb biomechanics, manual materials handling, and employee selection and fitness.
basic.subject: KHS
basic.title: Physical Bases Of Ergonomics
